very pleasant to taste or smell
‘The meal was absolutely delicious, ’ she said politely.
the delicious smell of new-mown grass
delicious.translation[0].note_box[0].sec: delicious
something that is delicious  tastes very good, and you enjoy eating or drinking it
The apple pie is delicious with vanilla ice cream.
tasty
food that is tasty  has a strong taste that you like
She makes a really tasty dish with chicken and rice.
succulent
succulent food contains a lot of juice and tastes good – used especially about fruit, vegetables, or meat
succulent melons
a succulent steak
appetizing
food that looks or smells appetizing  makes you feel that you want to eat it
The soup didn’t look very appetizing but it tasted delicious.
mouth-watering
food that is mouth-watering  smells or looks delicious, especially in a way that persuades you to buy or eat it
The waiter came round with a tray of mouth-watering cream cakes.
flavourful
having a strong pleasant taste – used especially in written descriptions
a flavourful red wine
yummy/scrumptious
tasting very good – used about food, not about drinks
Her homemade brownies are really yummy.
a scrumptious meal
